definition: to love/to be fond of/to like/affection/to be inclined (to do sth)/to tend to (happen)

sentences.english: He prized it beyond everything else.
sentences.chinese: 他愛惜這件東西勝過其他一切。

sentences.english: Amy extremely cherishes her own hair.
sentences.chinese: 艾咪非常愛惜自己的頭髮。

sentences.english: Our children are hard on furniture, too.
sentences.chinese: 我家孩子也是不愛惜傢俱。

sentences.english: Cheng Dingxiong have spare talented person of the four seasons, he agreed.
sentences.chinese: 程定雄本就愛惜四季人才，便同意了。

sentences.english: For if God spared not the natural branches, take heed lest he also spare not thee.
sentences.chinese: 神既不愛惜原來的枝子，也必不愛惜你。

sentences.english: For if God spared not the natural branches, take heed lest he also spare not thee.
sentences.chinese: 神既不愛惜原來的枝子，也必不愛惜你。

sentences.english: He is deeply attached to the old computer.
sentences.chinese: 他非常愛惜那臺舊電腦。

sentences.english: He is particularly careful with his car; I do not think we should borrow it.
sentences.chinese: 他對他的汽車愛惜有加，我看我們還是不借爲好。

sentences.english: It is advisable for you to criticize your naughty boy who is relentlessly tearing at the flowers he sees.
sentences.chinese: 你應該管管你那調皮的孩子，他見花就摘，毫不愛惜。

sentences.english: Redeeming the time, because the days are evil.
sentences.chinese: 要愛惜光陰，因爲現今的世代邪惡。

sentences.english: Love every inch of your body.
He is particularly careful with his car; I don't think we should borrow it.
sentences.chinese: 他對他的汽車愛惜有加，我看我們還是不借爲好。

sentences.english: "Maybe the killer ever hears a lot about you, he decided to treasure his live well. " Bob taunted.
sentences.chinese: 大概是兇手久仰過妳大名，他決定要好好愛惜生命了。

sentences.english: They relentlessly tear at the flowers they see.
sentences.chinese: 他們見花就摘，毫不愛惜。

sentences.english: Much as I love books, I take little care of them.
sentences.chinese: 我雖愛買書，而對於書卻不甚愛惜。

definition: to take a lot of trouble (over sb or sth)/may I trouble you (to do sth)
to bless/to cherish/to take good care of/to conserve
to fail to live up (to expectations)/unworthy (of trust)/to let down/to betray (hopes)/to disappoint
to place great importance on/to treasure
to advise/to urge/to try to persuade/to exhort/to console/to soothe
to turn a blind eye to/to ignore
making an all-out effort (idiom); to try one's heart out/to do one's utmost
